title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 10, ch. II, subch. L, pt. 86 - Reporting and Rate Certifications for Facilities
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 10, ch. II, subch. L, pt. 86 - Reporting and Rate Certifications for Facilities

State Regulations

Subpart 86-1 - Medical Facilities (§ 86-1.1 to 86-1.89)

Subpart 86-2 - Residential Health Care Facilities (§ 86-2.1 to 86-2.42)

Subpart 86-3 - Health Maintenance Organizations (§ 86-3.1 to 86-3.6 to 86-3.7)

Subpart 86-4 - Free-standing Ambulatory Care Facilities (§ 86-4.1 to 86-4.41)

Subpart 86-5 - Long-term Home Health Care Programs (§ 86-5.1 to 86-5.28)

Subpart 86-6 - Hospices (§ 86-6.1 to 86-6.7)

Subpart 86-7 - Assisted Living Program (§ 86-7.1 to 86-7.4)

Subpart 86-8 - Outpatient Services: Ambulatory Patient Group (§ 86-8.1 to 86-8.15)

Subpart 86-9 - Limited Home Care Services Agencies (§ 86-9.1 to 86-9.2)

Subpart 86-10 - Rates for Non-state Providers of Residential Habilitation in Community Residences, Including Individualized Residential, Including Individualizad Residential Alternatives (iras) and for Non-state Providers of Day Habilitation (§ 86-10.1 to 86-10.9)

Subpart 86-11 - Rate Setting for Non-state Providers: Intermediate Care Facilities for Persons with Developmental Disabilities (§ 86-11.1 to 86-11.10)

Subpart 86-12 - Outpatient Services Licensed Under the Mental Hygiene Law (§ 86-12.1 to 86-12.3)

Subpart 86-13 - Rates for Non-State Providers of Prevocational Services (Site-based) and Respite (Hourly and Free-standing), and fees for Prevocational Services (Community-based), Residential Habilitation (Family Care) and Supported Employment (§ 86-13.1 to 86-13.9)

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 10, ch. II, subch. L, pt. 86

Statutory authority: Public Health Law, §§201.1[v], 206, 2803, 2805-e, 2807, 2807-c, 2807-d-1, 2807-k, 2807-m, 2808, 2808-c, 3612, 3614, 4010; Social Services Law, §§ 363-a, 365- a[2]; L. 1983, ch. 758, § 7; L. 1993, ch. 731; L. 1995, ch. 81; L. 1996, ch. 639; L. 2008, ch. 58, part C, § 79[u]; L. 2009, ch. 58, part C, § 129[1]
State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
